title: ajc outjar jarfile does not contain MANIFEST.MF
description: When using the ajc command with the parameters sourceroots <mydir outjar <my.jar, an output file with a .jar extension is created, but it does not contain a valid MANIFEST.MF file. The ajc documentation mentions using outjar <file to put the output classes in a zip file, which suggests that it should create a zip file, but using a parameter called outjar to create a zip file does not make sense.
OB: When I call ajc sourceroots <mydir outjar <my.jar, an output file is created with a .jar extension, but it does not contain a valid MANIFEST.MF file.
EB: The output jar file should contain a valid MANIFEST.MF file.
SR:
1. Run the command ajc sourceroots <mydir outjar <my.jar 
2. Check the created output file <my.jar for the presence of a valid MANIFEST.MF file.
